It features succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically gray-green in color, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. This subspecies is notable for its compact growth habit and drought tolerance.
